meanings.definition: The state or quality of lacking excitement or noteworthy occurrences.
meanings.sent1: The uneventfulness of the movie made it difficult to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: Her life was filled with uneventfulness, with each day blending into the next.
meanings.sent3: The uneventfulness of the party was almost comical, with no one even noticing when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The uneventfulness of the small town was like a thick fog, enveloping everything in a blanket of monotony.
meanings.sent5: In the uneventfulness of the desert, time seemed to stretch endlessly, with nothing to break the monotony.

meanings.definition: The condition of being uneventful or unremarkable.
meanings.sent1: The uneventfulness of the meeting made it hard to remember any details.
meanings.sent2: His uneventfulness in class often went unnoticed by his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The uneventfulness of the weather was a relief after the stormy week.
meanings.sent4: The uneventfulness of the painting left the art critics unimpressed.
meanings.sent5: The uneventfulness of the day was shattered by a sudden burst of laughter from the children playing outside.
